name: Botticelli Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our 25th wedding anniversary at Hotel Botticelli. The staff was wonderful and made us feel very special. They gave us a bottle of sparkling Italian wine to celebrate our anniversary. The staff booked museums for us that allowed us to skip the long lines and they recommended and reserved wonderful restaurants for us - not one of which I could find in any guidebooks. The rooms are nice and very clean, but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff are what really made the difference for me. Also, the location is great - easy walking distance to most of the main atrractions. When I go back to Florence someday, I will stay at Hotel Botticelli again.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Botticelli

reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a fabulous trip to Italy, which included a stay at the Hotel Botticelli in Florence. The location of this Hotel is fantastic, a 1 minute walk to the San Lorenzo Market, and an easy short walk to the Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio. The Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was pretty good, rooms were clean, although a bit small. I would definetely stay there again on my return visit.....as we both rubbed the "boars" nose. Ciao Firenze...
reviews.title: Charming hotel, great locaation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2008. The hotel is very conveniently located by the Piazza del Mercato Centrale. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable. As with every room I've stayed in in Europe, the rooms are small. My best advice for travelers is don't bring a different outfit for every day - pack light! There are no drawers but we were able to fit one suitcase in the armoire. There is too much furniture in the room, making it seem even smaller. Our room was on the first floor overlooking a busy side street. It was noisy from about 7 am to midnight, but that coincided with our sleep plans, so it wasn't a problem. If you expect to sleep different hours, ask for an inside room. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Florence
Fantastic stay at Hotel Botticelli
reviews.text: We booked this through the hotel website and found that very easy. You simply print out the booking receipt and present it on arrival. When we got there the staff were friendly, helpful and courteous and offered us a range of rooms (with a view, quiet etc). The price proved to be excellent value for money; the decor is to a good standard for a 3 star hotel, the breakfast was adequate and the location perfect. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Florence; we can't imagine going anywhere else.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Botticelli Hotel, Florence, Italy
reviews.text: Hotel Botticelli is a great little hotel on the edge of Florence's historic centre and great value for money. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was spacious and very clean. The Santa Maria Novella train station is one a five minute walk away and the central markets is vitually next door where you can buy great tuscan produce.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a big disappointment for me, we had just came from Pisa after spending two glorious nights in a wonderful hotel for less than half the price we paid for Hotel Botticelli, having said that, the hotel was ok for location, breakfast very basic, staff were the only thing that would make you go back, they were absolutely beautiful, could not do enough for you. The room we had was clean as far as bed linen goes, but carpet grubby you were afraid to walk on it on your bare feet. walls were in bad need of a lick of paint, they were full of marks, bathroom spotless, nothing that a lick of paint wouldn't cure and a good scrubbing at the carpet, as i have said staff were faultless especially the girl on reception lovely lovely lovey. i would not pay the money again that we paid for it, it was way too expensive for what we got, the hotel in pisa was by far superior.
reviews.title: Nice but nothing special for the price!

reviews.title: Service Unsurpassed
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two week trip to Italy. Our stay in Florence was wonderful. We had a hire car and found the way to the Hotel Botticelli very easily. The location of the hotel was excellent. We were greeted with the utmost politeness from the front desk staff, Allesandro & Cecile. They were most helpful with all our requests. i.e.car parking facilities, maps around town, tour tickets and even replacing tickets when husbands misplaced them!!

The rooms were comfortable, clean and of a reasonable size. The bathrooms had lovely hot showers. The breakfast was delicious and the charming breakfast lady a real sweetheart. Allessandro and Cecile spoke excellent English and were patient with my developing Italian. We would certainly stay at the Botticelli again on our return and would not hesitate to recommend other stay at this hotel. The rates of the hotel were very attractive (but this was at a time when A$=US$0.90) and excellent value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent trip to Italy, we were in Florence for 4 days - the hotel we had booked was a great disappointment and while walking downtown, we came upon the Botticelli. The location was fantastic - in the heart of the center and situated near the Central Market of San Lorenzo. Fortunately, they had a room for us and the remainder of our Florentine adventure was so pleasant - in part due to the kindness of the hotel's Staff in supplying us with maps and shortcuts and helpful hints and indicating some really super restaurants. Our room, although not too large, was spotless with all the amenities - great shower - and a breathtaking view of the cupola of San Lorenzo from the lovely covered terrace where we wrote our postcards while enjoying a glass of wine. Breakfast was plentiful and varied - from cereals and fruit to sliced cheese and cold cuts. The coffee was divine! We would most definitely recommend the Botticelli to anyone going to Florence and we hope to be able to go back ourselves one day.
reviews.title: Great hotel--highly recommend!

reviews.text: My oldest daughter & I spent three glorious days in Florence using this lovely no frills hotel as our base. For starters, it is in a WONDERFUL location, walking distance from everything that is anything there (i.e., four minutes to Academia; 10-min to Ufitzy Museum; 8-min to Ponta Vechia bridge; 5-min to Duomo). The hotel is clean, off the beaten path so quiet, but minutes away from the action. Breakfast was superb. Cost was reasonable. Staff was VERY helpful calling to get us tours, museum reservations, and dinner recommendations and reservations. WE WILL GO AGAIN and stay here. It's simply lovely!
reviews.title: Great little getaway

reviews.text: I was travelling with 3 friends and after a very small room in Venice we were pleasantly surprsied at the size of our room-a double room with 2 separate beds and a sitting room turned into a bedroom. The room was spotless and the bathroom very modern and clean-adequate room over the bath to hang our washing! We were also pleased to see a lift for our luggage.

reviews.title: A Delightful haven in the heart of Florence
reviews.text: Hotel Botticelli is a true find in Florence. The small hotel is very comfortable, conveniently located in the historic center of Florence and very well priced. The Botticelli has the best staff we have ever encountered. They were very helpful, thoughtful and resourceful and assisted us with a number of unexpected requests as arrangements with credit cards and rental cars went awry and an additional member of our party joined us. From the multi-lingual staff at the front desk to the staff in the breakfast room to the cleaning staff, all were friendly and professional. The hotel is impeccably clean and well run; the daily complimentary breakfast is a delight with newspapers in several languages awaiting guests. The San Lorenzo location close to the Mercato Centrale makes it easy to walk all the sights and make a stop back at the hotel to refresh. Wi-fi in the lobby is a convenience. Rooms on the second and third floors are quieter but on the first floor (as Italy counts) we enjoyed the hum of the Florence street life - quite different from US. Terrific restaurants nearby. Pepo and Mario's are memorable. The Botticelli will not disappoint.
